question.title: Difference between artifactSet and extraArtifacts
question.body:
I don't fully understand documentation definitions. Why does only one of them accept version?

<artifactSet> definition:
Artifacts to include/exclude from the final artifact.
format: groupId:artifactId:type:classifier, accepts *, ? wildcards

<extraArtifacts> definition:
Extra Artifacts to infuse into shaded result.
format: GAV (groupId:artifactId[:extension[:classifier]]:version), no wildcards

question_comments.body: "Artifacts to include/exclude from the final artifact. Artifacts are denoted by composite identifiers of the general form groupId:artifactId:type:classifier. Since version 1.3, the wildcard characters '' and '?' can be used within the sub parts of those composite identifiers to do pattern matching. For convenience, the syntax groupId is equivalent to groupId::*:*, groupId:artifactId is equivalent to groupId:artifactId:*:* and groupId:artifactId:classifier is equivalent to groupId:artifactId:*:classifier. For example:" which means version is defined already as defined in a dep...
The artifactSet is related to the dependencies defined in the module you are using maven-shade-plugin in ....

extra artifacts: Extra Artifacts to infuse into shaded result. Accepts list of GAVs in form of <groupId>:<artifactId>[:<extension>[:<classifier>]]:<version‌​> that will be resolved. If any of them cannot be resolved, Mojo will fail. The artifacts will be resolved (not transitively), and will be processed in same way as dependency JARs are (if any): applied relocation, resource transformers and filtering. Note: this feature should be used lightly, is not meant as ability to replace dependency hull! It is more just a feature to be able to slightly "differentiate" shaded JAR from main only.
